org.gvsig.gpe
Class GPEFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.gvsig.gpe.GPEFactory

public class GPEFactory
extends java.lang.Object

API entry point to create parsers and writers based on MIME-Type identification.

This factory uses a SPI (Service Provider Interface) mechanism to look up for GPEParser and IGPEWriterHandlerImplementor implementations that can deal with a requested MIME-Type.

Implementation Lookup

The SPI mechanism keeps parser implementations decoupled from client applications allowing the transparent interchange of implementation, thus defining a format plugin system.

Parser and Writer implementations registers themselves lazily by providing a small configuration file bundled together with the rest of the implementation resources. This configuration file consist of a text file at a specific location and with an specific file name, this factory look up mechanism will search for in order to find out the implementation class names.

To register a GPEParser implememntation, a file named org.gvsig.gpe.parser.GPEParser shall exist in the class path (hence the ability to have multiple files equally namded budled in different jar files), in the implementation's META-INF/services folder.

To register a Writer handler implementation, the same approach shall be followed with a file named META-INF/services/org.gvsig.gpe.writer.IGPEWriterHandlerImplementor

The content of both files for a given implementation consists of full qualified class names, one per line. For example, an hypotetical MyFormatParser in the package org.mycompany.gpe and bundled in a jar file called myformat.jar shall provide the following resources: 

 
 $jar tvf myformat.jar
 META-INF/services/org.gvsig.gpe.parser.GPEParser
 org/mycompany/gpe/MyFormatParser.class
And the content of the file META-INF/services/org.gvsig.gpe.parser.GPEParser shall be a single line of text with the org.mycompany.gpe.MyFormatParser class name.

Author:
Jorge Piera LLodrá (jorge.piera@iver.es), Carlos Sánchez Periñán (sanchez_carper@gva.es)

createParserByClass

public static GPEParser createParserByClass(java.lang.String prefferredImplClassName)
                                     throws ParserCreationException
Create a new parser from a class name. This method can be used if the class name is known but, the common method to get a parser is using the mime type. *

Parameters:
prefferredImplClassName - The name of the class that implements GPEParser
Returns:
A parser for a concrete format
Throws:
ParserCreationException - If it is not possible to create a parser

createParser

public static GPEParser createParser(java.lang.String name)
                              throws ParserCreationException
Create a new parser from a parser name. This method can be used if the parser name is known but, the common method to get a parser is using the mime type.

Parameters:
name - The name of the parser, that is returned by the GPEParser.getName() method
Returns:
A parser for a concrete format
Throws:
ParserCreationException - If it is not possible to create a parser

createParser

public static GPEParser createParser(java.net.URI uri)
                              throws ParserCreationException
Create a new parser from a URI. Each parser has a method named GPEParser.accept(URI) that return true if the parser can be open the file.

This method retrieve all the registered parsers and invoke the accept method. The first parser that retuns true is returned. It means that if there are more that one parser to open a concrete file the first parser found will be returned.

Parameters:
uri - The place where the file is located
Returns:
A parser for a concrete format
Throws:
ParserCreationException - If it is not possible to create a parser

createParserByMimeType

public static GPEParser createParserByMimeType(java.lang.String mimeType)
                                        throws ParserCreationException
Create a new parser from a mime type. Each parser has a method named GPEParser.getFormat() that returns the mimetype that the parser can read. One parser only supports one mimetype.

This method retrieve all the parsers and returns the first parser that is able to read the mimetype. If there are more parsers that can open the file will not be used.

Parameters:
mimeType - The mimetype of the file to open
Returns:
A parser that can parse the mimetype.
Throws:
ParserCreationException - If it is not possible to create a parser
See Also:
http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/

createWriter

public static GPEWriterHandler createWriter(java.lang.String name)
                                     throws WriterHandlerCreationException
Create a new writer from a writer name. This method can be used if the writer name is known but, the common method to get a writer is using the mime type.

Parameters:
name - The name of the writer, that is returned by the GPEWriterHandler.getName() method
Returns:
A writer for a concrete format
Throws:
WriterHandlerCreationException - If it is not possible to create a writer

createWriterByClass

createWriterByMimeType

public static GPEWriterHandler createWriterByMimeType(java.lang.String mimeType)
                                               throws WriterHandlerCreationException
Create a new writer from a mime type. Each writer has a method named GPEWriterHandler.getFormat() that returns the mimetype that the writer can write. One writer only supports one mimetype.

This method retrieve all the writers and returns the first one that is able to write the mimetype. If there are more writer that can write the format will not be used.

Parameters:
mimeType - The mimetype of the file to write
Returns:
A writer that can write the mimetype.
Throws:
WriterHandlerCreationException - If it is not possible to create a writer
See Also:
http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/

accept

public static boolean accept(java.net.URI uri)
Return true if there is a parser that is able to open the file or false instead.

Parameters:
uri - The file to open
Returns:
true if there is a parser that is able to open the file
